issue.title: [CF 322] Bug for reset icon
issue.body:
L["RESET_NOTIFY"] and L["RESET_EXPIRE"] won't show anything when you click the reset button.


> Posted by CurseForge user lsjyzjl | Imported from CurseForge issue #322 | Raw

comments.body:
I put code in so that after you successfully reset 5 icons, it stops showing that. I figured that after that, people probably know how resetting an icon works and don't need to be spammed.

Do you think that I should remove this feature? I hate the spam people's chat every time they reset an icon, but I also don't want to leave people wondering why their icon won't reset.

What I have considered doing is removing this feature, and instead have a restore button appear. It would probably be a dropdown that contains a list of icons (or more specifically, icon data) from that icon slot that were reset since the last login/reload. Or maybe I will include every single change made to that icon since logging in, but that would be a little harder as far as implementation goes. But cooler. And more useful.

I don't have anything happening this weekend, so I will figure something out.

(I think I just made a mountain out of a molehill.)

> Posted by CurseForge user lsjyzjl

The condition bugs are probably because of some re-coding that I did to fix some frame rate lag when undoing and redoing. The old method involved completely loading the group condition frame and the icon condition frame (which are technically the same frame, they just get re-purposed depending on which you are looking at). Blizzard's dropdown menu code is horribly inefficient, so resetting and then setting all of the condition type dropdowns was causing a noticeable FPS loss.

One thing that is also an issue is that it records almost too many changes. Changing a condition value slider with the mouse wheel will put every single change in value into the queue because of the way it is saved and the way that the undo engine looks for changes. I will probably just put a timer on it - something like an interval of 1 second to check for changes made to the settings.
